item.title: Pedestrian crossing road markings, 24th June
item.description:
White road markings worn away. CROSSING USEDBY PLAY GROUP CHILDREN GOING TO CHURCH HALL EVERY DAY. OUTSIDE CHURCH.

item.title: Dog owners using estate lawn for toileting and exercising, 24th June
item.description:
Kids should be able to run around this estate space without encountering dogs from off the estate and their associated mess. GATE NEEDS LOCKING and “NO DOGS” SIGN NEEDED as with space in front of Mandalay. Plenty of room in the park for dogs. NOT RESOLVED!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burma Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spray tags on multiple road signs, 24th June
item.description:
Usual spray tagging menace has vandalised the backs of all the road signs along this stretch of Kings Hall Road on the grass verge near the tennis courts (black paint on grey metal signs, at least 5 or 6 of them).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, London

item.title: Width Restriction Bollard Uprooted, 24th June
item.description:
Yet again a bollard has been uprooted to allow a heavy goods vehicle through the width restriction in Auckland Road near the corner with Belvedere Road. As usual there appears to have been no lock in place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Auckland Road, Crystal Palace, London

item.description:

item.title: Unneccesary barrier on pavement, 24th June
item.description:
Since 2023, there has been a hoarding/barrier on one pavement along Palmer St. This despite there being no construction activity on the site of a building demolished in 2023. The permit for this barrier expired on 7th June 2025. Without access to one pavement, pedestrians tend to walk down what is a narrow street with a tube entrance/exit that is very busy at times. This results in frequent near-misses as well as congestion on the single pavement that’s accessible. Until construction work commences we request that we have our street back and that the existing barrier be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Palmer Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet
